page.title: 10THE SCHOOL SITE.
page.content: A map of the Copthorne area of Shrewsbury dated 1882 shows a claypit on what is now the site of St Georges County Junior School Woodfield Road. A field called Brickfield was very near the claypit and a brick kiln is also shown. There is also evidence of a tramway connecting with the site. A later map dated 1938 of the same area shows Woodfield Road and Woodfield Avenue. Near our school there was a Roman roadway which was incorporated into the Shrewsbury By-Pass. We have been told that our present school playing field was previously a rubbish tip, which in turn was built over the old playpit.
